bug.short_desc: Turkish Q Keyboard special characters does not work in Wayland session
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Hello,
I am using an updated version of Fedora 25. If I login to system with wayland, the special characters of Turkish (ı İ Ğ Ü ü ğ ) and Alt_Gr button does not work.
This bug is filed under https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1389968 but there is no updates.
I searched this bug in upstream and found that this bug was also filled in gnome and closed by mutter developers with RESOLVED NOTGNOME flag.
Gnome adress that this problem related to libxkbcommon in their bugzilla. libxkbcommon upstream also filed an issue[1] related this problem
It seems that this commit[2] solves problem and as far as I see there is no stable release which includes this patch.
Could you kindly include this patch in libxkbcommon package if this is "the solution"
[1]: https://github.com/xkbcommon/libxkbcommon/issues/42 [2]:https://github.com/xkbcommon/libxkbcommon/commit/b5586a6c4294b46eb23d1fc527ff63dcd27e23ac
Thanks for your effort.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
0.6.1
How reproducible:
Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Set keyboard map to Turkish Q 2. Reboot system and login with Wayland 3. Try to type Turkish special characters ı İ and try to type other characters with Alt_Gr button like @ $ ¾
Actual results:
I can not type this characters if I login with Wayland
Expected results:
Keyboard must work without a problem

libxkbcommon's maintainer is planning a new release very soon: https://github.com/xkbcommon/libxkbcommon/issues/42#issuecomment-273543312
Hopefully it will get to Fedora just as quickly. :)

The fixed release has been submitted for testing: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-766da1b4ef
It would be great if you could test it and give appropriate karma.
libxkbcommon-0.7.1-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-766da1b4ef

libxkbcommon-0.7.1-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-766da1b4ef

Hello,
This update solves bug and works perfect. I gave appropriate karma in bodhi. It seems that there is a problem in my connection and I gave same karma more than one time. Sorry for the mess and thanks for your effort to solve this issue.
Btw, could you kindly other related bug as a duplicate and inform the that bug CC list.
Thanks again...
